name: Myrica
Relationship: Antidote: DIGIT. (JAUNDICE).Compare: PTEL.; CORNUS.; CHELID.; LEPT.; FAGOP.

Head: Scalp feels tight
Pain and stiffness in nape of neck
Headache, with drowsiness; yellow sclerotica; aching in eyeballs
Pressure in vertex and forehead
Dull, heavy aching in temples and forehead on waking in the morning
Stomach: Weak, sinking feeling in the epigastrium, approaching nausea; increased after eating; relieved by rapid walking
Complete loss of appetite, but with a feeling of fullness in the stomach after a hearty meal
Taste bitter and nauseous, with offensive breath
Stool: Constant discharge of flatus when walking
Urging to stool, with no other results than the expulsion of a great amount of flatus
Loose, light-colored stool; ash-colored and destitute of bile
Abdomen: Fullness in the stomach and abdomen
Complete jaundice, with bronze-yellow skin; loss of appetite
Dull pain in the region of the liver
Throat: Constricted and rough feeling, with a constant desire to swallow
Sleep: Disturbed, bad dreams and frequent waking; insomnia
Mouth: Tongue furred, with bad taste in mouth, and nausea
Extremities: Pain under shoulder-blades and back of neck, in all muscles, in hollow of right foot

details: Marked action on the liver, with jaundice and mucous membranes. Persistent sleeplessness. JAUNDICE.
